intro: Calochortus clavatus var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of spring-blooming bulbs known for their showy, often showy flowers. This particular variety is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and pale to yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is an important species in local ecosystems.
